Author: snarflakes
Content: https://github.com/snarflakes/PiEthereumWallet

Author: snarflakes
Content: I've been working on blockchain devices for over a year now and wanted to do something open source that included a token swapping function.  So I came up with a  decentralized/permissionless ETH hardware wallet (Raspberry Pi inside) with uniswap v3 contract direct token Swap and physically transferrable private keys. There are two scripts, one L1, and other using uniswap v3 on polygon (an L2). For swaps, I'm using the opensource python-uniswap python module, which has an incredibly simple to customize contract direct function.  You can easily pick and change some variables to have the device work with whatever swapping pair you would like!

Author: david_23s5
Content:
Demeter gives users the power to launch incentivized liquidity pools on Uniswap v3. Future versions will support custom liquidity shapes on major DEXs such as Balancer, Saddle, Sushiswap or anything veSPA holders prefer. Demeter V1 is launched on Arbitrum and will be expanded to Optimism, Polygon and Ethereum soon. Additional blockchains will be added in future versions.

Doc: https://docs.sperax.io/demeter-protocol 
Confirmed partners: https://twitter.com/speraxusd/status/1585297941136576512?s=21&t=UeDGWSn50rsYC2HGsE11iQ

Would love to hear feedbacks / questions!

Author: AnthonyNicholas#4331
Content: Fire! How do you alternate between L1 and L2 with the device? Is there a button you push?

Author: AnthonyNicholas#4331
Content: Awesome! Why did you decide to deploy on Arbitrum first?

Author: david_23s5
Content: Yep it was because our native stablecoin USDs is on Arbitrum and we have launched a lot of Uni V3 farms on Arbitrum (https://app.sperax.io/farm). So naturally we want to start from Arbitrum. But planning to expand to more chains soon.

Author: snarflakes
Content: I was going to code a button push to switch chains on the fly, but I had concerns about the user getting confused as to which layer they were on (even with visual cues), or more specifically for a total noob not even understanding the difference between the two chains and accidentally pressing the button.  So at this point, when selecting the device boot script, you would point the booter to either the polygon python file or the ETH file.  I'm very open to coding the button switch directly onto the device, it just depends on what participants would prefer.  It would be super cool to just switch L1/L2 layers with a button click (pretty simple too).

Author: snarflakes
Content: now that i think about it, since the address is the same for L1/L2, confusing which chain the user is on is probably inconsequential. Unless the displayed differential L1/L2 gas prices ends up being a source of confusion...

Author: AnthonyNicholas#4331
Content: I'd love to see a demo if you're able to film it. Maybe when a user changes chains, there's a delay on the UI and a color change (example - L1 is green, L2 is blue)

Author: crypto_rachel
Content:
So getting chain ID is really for wallets to know what chain it's connected to.

uniswap is currently on 5 chains, the addresses are the same for 4 out of 5 chains, (with exception to celo having different addresses)
```
1       ETH
137     Polygon
42161   Arbitrum
10      Optimism

42220   Celo 
```
here are the deploy docs, and my list of addresses
https://discord.com/channels/597638925346930701/607978109089611786/970405461205585930

Author: ilia.eth
Content:
0xPlasma Labs have launched a new **Quadrat protocol** for professional work with Uniswap v3 as a liquidity provider. Quadrat is a non-custodial, permissionless active liquidity management protocol for Uniswap v3. It is designed to automatically rebalance assets in Uniswap v3 liquidity pools, enabling users to earn the highest annual percentage yield (APY) on every liquidity pool, and also help Uniswap v3 concentrate liquidity at trading price range more capital efficiently and attract more trading volume.

Because of 95% of users do not manage their capital efficiently, they don't earn anything in the protocol, and only 2% of liquidity providers made $500M from Uniswap fees last year. Quadrat is a much-needed solution that will enable all users to earn an APY on their liquidity, regardless of their expertise or time commitment. With Quadrat, users can earn **up to 10x more APY** than they would without it.

With Uniswap v3 being one of the most popular DeFi protocols, Quadrat is well positioned to become the leading liquidity provider and manager for Uniswap v3, and earn a significant return on provided liquidity for its users.

The rebalancing feature allows rebalancing liquidity in Uniswap pools in one click. It helps liquidity providers to maximize their APY by constantly rebalancing their pools to reflect changes in market conditions. Anyone can create a strategy to manage their capital or a public strategy to manage public capital with a revenue share model.

Quadrat Protocol is only available for** Quadrat NFT Pass owners**. NFT Pass is fully liquid and trading in the liquidity pool on **SudoSwap** (Uniswap NFT protocol)

**For Liquidity Providers**:
- Provide liquidity in the Quadrat Strategies for any Uniswap v3 Pool with the highest APY and endless active rebalancing strategies, decreasing your IL
- Monitor your positions, APY, IL, volume and rebalance assets between strategies
- Fully non-custodial and permissionless protocol, passively improving your APY from the liquidity provision
- Current 0xPlasma Strategies APY is in the range between 50 and 500% APY for a basic assets: USDT, BTC, AAVE, ETH, UNI, Matic, etc.

**For Asset (liquidity) Managers**:
- create private strategies for personal funds or create public strategies, manage capital and earn performance fee
- rebalance your position in one transaction, saving gas fees with an advanced quantum rebalancer and pool calculator
- integrate your strategies in gnosis safe or investment DAO to scale the investment tools

**For Token Projects**:
- Create optimal strategies for your token liquidity pool on Uniswap v3 and let your community provide more liquidity and earn fees

**For Uniswap v3 Protocol**l:
- Quadrat protocol attracts more liquidity and optimizes Uniswap v3 Pools; as a result, pools become more capital efficient, attract more trading volume and help earn more fees for LP
- Quadrat's simple UI allows new DeFi users to passively provide capital and learn how Uniswap v3 works.

üîó **Helpful links**
WP: https://quadrat.plasma.finance/
Site: https://plasma.finance/quadrat
Twitter: https://twitter.com/0xQuadrat

It would be great if we can discuss the UniGrant Program and Governance Support of the Quadrat Protocol.
Looking forward,
Ilia (CEO at 0xPlasma Labs)

Author: AnthonyNicholas#4331
Content: Hey Ilia, thanks for sharing! How often does plasma manage your position? Every time the price moves outside?

Author: ilia.eth
Content:
Hi, we have 2 types of strategies:
- 0xPlasma Strategies (based on our algos)
- Public Strategies from other Asset Managers

Our 0xPlasma Strategies and rebalancing algorithm are based on many factors ( you can find them here: https://quadrat.plasma.finance/quadrat-strategies/rebalancing-algorithm)
- sometimes it's rebalancing from range to a new range
- sometimes it's squeezing or spreading the current range
- sometimes it's 100% rebalanced in Asset A or Asset B, to decrease the IL and capture some revenue from the price movement and not from the fees.

Author: seandablimp
Content:
Hi everyone, **Diamond Unibot** is a leveraged liquidity provision platform for Uniswap V3 where users can hedge their LP positions by borrowing and forming long/short on the volatile asset in a V3 pair. Diamond Unibot is built upon the Arbitrum network and currently supports the USDC/ETH 0.05% pool. This is an invite-only platform for now, please join our discord to learn more. Audit report by Quantstamp is due to be released by Dec 15th, 2022.

Core Features:
-üíé Users provide USDC only to open a V3 position on Unibot at either 1.5x (Net Long), 2x (Neutral), 2.5x (Net Short) or 3x leverage (Net Short). 
-üíé The corresponding amount of ETH will be borrowed from our Diamond Pool to complete your position.
-üíé Users are able to select their own range
-üíé Users are able to set a stop loss to close their positions at certain ETH prices
-üíé Net profit comes from enhanced Uniswap Fees & long/short profit 

Join us to find out more. 

Diamond Discord: https://discord.com/invite/PGGdPaecVt
Unibot: https://unibot.dmo.finance/factory
https://link3.to/diamondprotocol

Author: kedieo
Content:
Hello everyone, 

I'm Paul from KYVE Team. Nice to e-meet you all! :flyingunicorn: 

**What is KYVE?**

KYVE is a Web3 data lake solution and protocol enabling data providers to standardize, validate in a decentralized way, and store any data streams into decentralized storage solutions such as Arweave. 

We are partners (and they are also our investors) with most of the L1s (Solana, Polkadot, Near, Avalanche, Celo, Moonbeam, Cosmos, etc.)

**How it works briefly? **

Basically, for each data source, you need to create a pool. For example, to connect to archive the Solana blockchain, you will create a pool and fund it with KYVE token; nodes (PoS mechanism) will join the pool and will start to archive the blockchain into the storage solution that you decided during the creation of the pool. When data are uploaded, your funding decrease to pay the nodes. When the data are uploaded, they're free to access and store forever if you use for example, Arweave.

**Why am I coming on the Uniswap Discord to talk about KYVE?**

Great news we just released a pool today... **This new integration archives all swaps, mints, burns & more from the USDC-ETH Uniswap smart contract**. With over 100k+ transactions occurring on Uniswap each day, it can be quite tedious to query through all this data & find exactly what you need. 

Not to mention the possible need to source from multiple different providers, opening yourself up to risk. Having a trustless source that validates this data in a decentralized way is imperative in order to perform proper analyses & research or even to create trustless platforms & dashboards for users to follow their trading. 

Via this integration, anyone can easily access all events that occurred on the USDC-ETH Uniswap smart contract in order to perform market analyses, user data dashboards, research, etc. üßë‚Äçüíª

& the best part you don't pay to acess the data you remember! That's cool no? 

**We are still in testnet so the PoS mechanism is not implemented yet, we recommend you don't use this data for the moment in another way than testing!  **

Want to learn more how KYVE work and how you can access data: https://docs.kyve.network/
GitHub: https://github.com/KYVENetwork

Author: priyankc
Content:
Hey all - We recently added Uniswap data to MakerDojo (https://makerdojo.io) - an AI-backed Web3 data platform where you can get insights by asking questions in plain English without requiring you to write SQL. We are also a data source / provider for Uniswap Community Analytics Grant program (https://unigrants.notion.site/Getting-started-with-Uniswap-Analytics-0d325ecd19ca4f9d91ee9bb4bd2e0277)

With Uniswap data, you can dig into insights like TVL, fees, volume, etc., by simply asking them in English.

Here are some example questions you could ask and get answers for:
    ‚ÄúWhat is the total value locked in the WETH/DAI Uniswap pool?‚Äù
    ‚ÄúWhat is the 7-day moving average volume for the UNI/USDC pool?‚Äù
    ‚ÄúWhat is the 24-hour change in liquidity for the UNI/USDT pool?‚Äù
    ‚ÄúWhat was the total fee collected by the WBTC/WETH pool last month?‚Äù

Please try it out and let us know how we could improve the product for your specific use cases. I'm looking forward to your feedback.

(Thanks @Anthony ü¶Ñ // Community Manager  for recommending to post here)

Author: ninja_dev
Content:
Hello everyone, I was ted to share a project I made for the low cap space if crypto.

It's a data aggregator for buy data going through routers. The tokens are than ranked based on various specs. Each token also shows safety data like if it's a honeypot, tax information, etc.

Additionally it will show the contract information, functions to find hidden scammy functions, and other key information right at your fingertips.

This helps traders find projects early on while also keeping them as safe possible.

https://app.buildalpha.io

Author: theunconstrainedmind
Content:
Hello Uniswap community!

We wanted to share with you a project that we believe aligns with the decentralized ethos that Uniswap represents - Literully.

Literully is a decentralized voting platform built on the Polygon blockchain. Our goal is to empower communities to make transparent and decentralized decisions through the use of smart contracts. We believe that this is crucial for the continued growth and success of the decentralized ecosystem.

We are soon to launch our governance token, Decentralight (DLT), which will be used to monetize the decentralized solutions that Literully has or will have. DLT will also be used as your voting power when it comes to decision making processes within the Literully platform.

We think that Uniswap and Literully complement each other well and we would love to explore any potential opportunities for collaboration.

Let us know if you have any questions or if you're interested in learning more about Literully and DLT.

Website: https://literully.com/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/literully
Polygonscan: https://polygonscan.com/token/0x4cc2f9dc2822de042248669d1e9989a1220c3d21

Best,
Literully Team

Author: fabcotech#6288
Content: Uniswap and other DeFi projects still **work mainly with DNS and the flawed web PKI technology**, in browsers there are like 100-400 organization able to **impersonate any domain name**. We've created a privacy+security focused alternative to DNS and the web PKI, it's called dappy, domains end with .d. We've designed it mainly for web3 and high value web apps. Happy to have a chat if someone is interested. https://dappy.tech

Author: derekbarrera
Content:
We've built a full development and automation platform for liquidity providers and traders at Steer Protocol. We allow liquidity providers to build CLAMM algo with multiple positions in a given strategy. This means you can place liquidity which can emulate CEX style liquidity in a single transaction. We also have a backtesting toolkit as well where developers and protocols and visualize and run against real mainnet data (with rebalances over time!) how their liquidity and apys would look. 

We are the first platform that provides the ability for the general public to see APYs for liquidity positions that rebalance over time. 

Here is our announcement article, we go live in 30-45 days but you can start building today. 

All strategists developers get 5% of all yield that occurs through their algos.

https://steer.finance/the-future-of-market-making-on-the-web3/

Author: derekbarrera
Content: We are the first full development platform ontop of uniswap which allows strategies to be built with both on-chain and off-chain data with a permissionless protocol to launch and run them.

Author: theunconstrainedmind
Content: Stampeet can be useful for Uniswap in a number of ways. One example is that it can be used to verify important information related to token swaps or liquidity pool transactions, such as the time and date of the transaction and the parties involved. This can help to increase transparency and trust in the Uniswap ecosystem. Additionally, private messaging on Stampeet could be used by Uniswap to communicate important information securely between team members or with their community. Overall, Stampeet can provide additional security and transparency to Uniswap and help to improve the overall user experience.

Author: theunconstrainedmind
Content:
We are excited to announce that Stampeet is now available in beta version! We would like to invite you to try it out and share your valuable feedback with us.

Stampeet is a revolutionary protocol that allows you to stamp your message and secure the authority on blockchain, forever! With Stampeet, you can also stamp private messages and ensure they remain confidential through encryption mechanisms.

We would love to hear your thoughts on the features, user experience, and any improvements you would like to suggest.

https://literully.com/stampeet

Content:

META GOLD MINERS CLUB - 


The Meta Gold Miners Club (MGMC) is a project inspired by the world we live in today, and is focused on sharing knowledge with it's members about important financial concepts, and helping increase the wealth of our community through our Gold Rewards Program (GRP). 

We will provide education to our community about concepts such as Sound Money Principles, and the role that gold and bitcoin can play in preserving wealth; alongside other utilities that bring exclusive value to our NFT holders.

With **GOLD-BACKED NFTS**, the MGMC presents a unique opportunity for members to diversify their holdings, reduce risk, and learn about new technologies. MGMC gold backed NFTs will be a solution to the problem of establishing and maintaining inherent value in digital assets, which are often based on hype or utility alone, with no guaranteed floor price.

By backing our NFTs with gold, we aim to provide a stable store of value for our members. All tied together with a story that is relevant to the modern world in order to interact with our community in a fun and engaging way.

Author: ortutay#3557
Content:
We are working on Delorean.exchange, a protocol for selling (and buying) future real yield.

üíÅ The protocol is launching with support for GLP and GMX tokens, and you can sell up to two years of projected yield on those. It is like a self repaying loan, and you can sell one week of yield or months or years.

:Uni: We are using Uniswap V3 under the hood to manage liquidity. Specifically, liquidity providers mint "npvETH-GLP" representing future yield from GLP, and add those to a univ3 pool swapping with WETH.

üíß  We chose Uniswap V3 because of the concentrated liquidity feature. npvETH-GLP is expected to be priced very close to 1:1 with WETH, and liquidity providers can use CL to make efficient use of their liquidity. Additionally, the price is expected to only drift *below* 1 if the 1:1 soft-peg is broken, another great use case for CL

‚è≠Ô∏è    Learn more about us at https://delorean.exchange/ where you can sign up for early access. Join our discord for updates and info: https://discord.gg/maT3fJGaES

Author: maxzenith
Content:
Hey Folks,

I represent CoW Protocol, a meta dex aggregator with MEV protection. We are a collaborator in the launch of a new innovative RPC endpoint: https://mevblocker.io/

It has many benefits for users including front-run and sandwich protection. Most importantly there's a new auction mechanism where searchers bid on the back-run opportunity and >90% of proceeds are shared back with the user.

 We're looking for launch partners which can be any Dapp that wants to place a

**"Get protection, add MEVblocker to your wallet" button.**

**Any wallet builders can offer it as a default RPC to users**

I would love your feedback and thoughts about it as soon as possible since we are slowly launching this week.

Cheers, 
Max

PS: We don't store or use data for profit nor intend to put ourselves on the spot. Most importantly, we are aligned with the core values of our space.

Author: ducktape3088
Content:
Hello, not specifically building on but for the Uniswap community, hope it is ok to share!

I am building a decentralized Peer-to-Peer lending protocol for web3 communities. The platform will create community pools where only eligible members of a DAO will be able to borrow from the pool. Our solution will additionally vet borrowers based on their on-chain revenues and activity, allowing web3 natives to build their off-chain credit scores.

For lenders, our model aims to provide a real yield between 6-8% that is not correlated with the market, offering a sustainable and attractive return on investment.

We are specifically targeting Web3 borrowers with a credit score of 600 or above offering competitive borrowing rates of 10-12% for personal loans. In case of a default, the borrowers would be reported to credit bureaus, impacting their credit scores and future loan eligibility. 

Curious to become a Lender or a Borrower? I would be thrilled to discuss this in more detail and gain insights from your perspective. Please let me know if you are curious and open to exploring this further.

Best

Author: nonseodion
Content:
I just published the first issue of my smart contract security-focused newsletter, reHackt.

It focuses on reHacking hacked protocols using Foundry. In this first issue I talked about the Cover Protocol hack. 

The article goes over the vulnerability, the hackers thought process and how the attack was carried out.

We also write a Solidity script to hack the protocol using Foundry. Lastly, we apply a fix to fix the vulnerability.

Here's a link to the issue. If you do like it, please do subscribe and share. I'll be writing more and you'll get them directly in your inbox if u subscribe. The next issue will be on the Euler protocol hack.

https://open.substack.com/pub/rehackt/p/cover-protocol-infinite-minting-machine?utm_source=share&utm_medium=android&r=2wnv5

Author: tylerether
Content:
Hey everyone, I'm here to introduce Adrastia, an oracle system that sources data and does computations entirely onchain. It aggregates prices and liquidity across a variety of DEXs such as Uniswap v2, v3, Balancer v2, Curve, and Algebra.

It's different from Uniswap oracles, not only because it aggregates many pools, but also because it performs seven layers of validation. Adrastia is unmatched in terms of security mechanisms.

Additionally, while Uniswap v3 oracles can only provide TWAPs up to 24 hours, Adrastia can provide TWAPs over months at a time.

Not only does Adrastia provide price and liquidity feeds, but we also provide volatility and average interest rate feeds with our latest v4 update.

These data feeds can even be plugged into our novel rate controller system, Adrastia Prudentia, to take DeFi risk management to the next level! Prudentia can be used to secure and improve interest rates, supply&borrow caps, collateral factors, and more!

Check out our v4 tweet thread for more info: https://twitter.com/AdrastiaOracle/status/1682020932796432384

Author: blackjesus69
Content:
Hey everyone! I am a junior dev building my first project and would like some feedback on the UI.

My aim for application to give the user as much useful information as possible with just glance at the page. If you have any recommendations 
on alpha I can offer the user I will try my best to add what I can. 

The application is not live yet but I am close to having an MVP for users to test out. I am the only person working on the project so delays may occur...

Thanks for reading and I look forward to any feedback you may have!
